With a talented cast and an inspiring plot, "The Whistler" is a must-see for fans of reference movies.

Based on these constraints, I recommend "Wolf Creek" and "Smilla's Sense of Snow". Both are psychological thrillers that explore the darker side of human nature, with a focus on suspenseful storytelling and strong performances. "Wolf Creek" follows three backpackers who are stalked and killed by a sadistic local in the Australian outback, while "Smilla's Sense of Snow" delves into the mystery surrounding the death of a young Inuit boy who falls from a snowy roof in Copenhagen. Both films are sure to keep you on the edge of your seat!
